translated: The Elder Nuns’ Verses of the Therīs
The Chapter with Kuṇḍalakesī

analyzed: yasodharā apamukha dasa bhikkhunī sahassa apadāna
translated: The Story of the Thousand Elder Nuns with Yasodharā at their Head
“For a hundred thousand eons,
and for four incalculable eons,
there was a Victor named Dīpaṅkara,
who arose as a leader of the world.
The great hero Dīpaṅkara,
the guide, proclaimed:
‘Sumedha and Sumitta,

analyzed: samāna sukha dukkha ta  sa devakam ca passanto
translated: share the same happiness and suffering.’🔽Seeing the world with its gods,
wandering with its gods,
he approached us,
and we came together.
Be our lord,
in the future gathering.
We are all your wives,
pleasing, speaking pleasantly.
All our generosity and virtue,
and our well-developed meditation,
for a long time, all of us,
we have given up, great sage.
Perfume, ointments, garlands,
and an island made of jewels,
whatever is wished for, all of it,
we have given up, great sage.
And any other deed,
and human enjoyment,
for a long time, all of us,
we have given up, great sage.”
For many a birth and death we wandered,
but no great fruit was gained by us.
Having experienced sovereignty,🔽wandering through the round of births,
In our last existence we were born
in the house of the Sakyan’s son.
We were born in various families,
sugar-makers, and beautiful women.
We gained wealth and fame,

analyzed: pūjitā sabba sakkatā  lābhiyaḥ anna pānāna
translated: we were honoured and respected by all.🔽We were always honoured

original: sadā sammānitā mayaṁ.🔽Agāraṁ pajahitvāna,🔽pabbajimhanagāriyaṁ;🔽Aḍḍhamāse asampatte,🔽sabbā pattāmha nibbutiṁ.🔽Lābhiyo annapānānaṁ,
analyzed: sadā sammānitā maya  agāram  pabbajimhanagāriya  aḍḍha māse a sampatte  sabbā pattāmha nibbuti  lābhiyaḥ anna pānāna
translated: and were recipients of food and drink,
and of robes and lodging.

original: Upenti paccayā sabbe,🔽sadā sakkatapūjitā.🔽Kilesā jhāpitā amhaṁ,
analyzed: upenti paccayā sabbe  sadā sakkata pūjitā  kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ amha
translated: All our defilements were burnt up,
and we live without defilements.
Welcome indeed was it to us,
and the Buddha’s instruction has been accomplished.
The four analytical knowledges,
and the Buddha’s instruction has been accomplished.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ yasodharāpamukhāni dasabhikkhunīsahassāni bhagavato sammukhā imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam yasodhara apamukhāni dasa bhikkhunī sahassāni bhagavato sammukhāḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus the ten thousand nuns headed by Yasodharā recited these verses in the presence of the Lord.

analyzed: yasodharā apamukha dasa bhikkhunī sahassa apadānam navama
translated: The Story of the Thousand Bhikkhunis headed by Yasodhara is finished.
